column1: an entity that has physical existence
column2: ['any entity that produces an effect or is responsible for events or results', 'that which has mass and occupies spacephysicists study both the nature of matter and the forces which govern it', 'a tangible and visible entity; an entity that can cast a shadowit was full of rackets, balls and other objects', 'a sustained phenomenon or one marked by gradual changes through a series of statesevents now in process the process of calcification begins later for boys than for girls', 'material of a particular kind or constitutionthe immune response recognizes invading substances', 'a separate and self-contained entity']
